Though history demonstrated that the farms were acq for economic pes in order to st schools and rsities, the estancias were of co  \u201cfor missionary pes, thus tg into religious centers.\u201d Estancias in Jes\xfas Mar\xeda, Caroya, Santa Catalina, La Candelaria and Alta Gracia can be visited along a 250&nbsp;km circuit. These farms that date back to the 17th century \u2014together with the Jesuit Block and Estancias of C\xf3rdoba in the C\xf3rdoba, Argentina|City of C\xf3rdoba\u2014 are all national historical mons that were declared World Heritage Site in 2000.\n\nFile:Ischigto national park.jpg|thumb|left|Ischigto on the border of San Juan Province, Argentina with the Argentina province of La Rioja Province, Argentina rg into the second through the canyons of Talampaya National Park\nFile:C del obispo 01.jpg|thumb|left|C del Obispo one of the Saltan entrances to the Calchaqu\xed Valleys. \n* Ischigto, also known as The Moon Valley, offers a strange landscape where the scarcity of vegetation and the more varied range vegetation of its soils plus the al forms of its rocks (geoforms) and mons, make this a favorite place for tos, both domestic and foreign. This provincial park, declared List of World Heritage Sites in Argentina by UNESCO, is located at the northern end of the San Juan Province, Argentina. It is also a major paleontology center became famous because it is the only place where it can be seen completely exposed and perfectly differentiated the whole Triassic period as complete and orderly, where the oldest fossils in the world were found. The Moon Valley, so named because of the diverse forms and colours of its landscape shaped by erosion, continues in the Argentinian province of La Rioja Province, Argentina with the Talampaya National Park. The Talampaya River Canyon reveals m-shaped layers in its high red walls. Pink flamingos, Andean d, \u201cvicu\xf1as\u201d and \u201cgos\u201d cohabit freely in parks and nat reserves, while condors fly over the area. \nFile:Robben-001.jpg|thumb|Sea lions on the shores of the Patagonia\nFile:J-Parca-P3120033.JPG|thumb|The Qda de Haca view from Parca in the J Province\n* Qda de Haca\n* Calchaqu\xed Valleys\n* Iber\xe1 Wetlands\n* Puna de Atacama\n\nThe Qda de Haca, the Calchaqu\xed Valleys, the Puna de Atacama (incl Salar de Arizaro, the Laguna de Poz Nat Mon, the Campo de Piedra P\xf3mez etc.), Ischigto, Talampaya, the Aconcagua, Caviahue and Copahue, near snow-capped mons with temperate rainforests and glacial lakes; Andean Patagonia national parks, etc. constitute the to corridor called the Andean Footprint (H Andina) which is largely covered by National Route 40 (Argentina).\n\n\n\n\nFile:Mar-del-plata-playa.JPG|thumb|Two of the beaches of Mar del Plata d s to season\nFile:Aconcagua.8.22.03w.jpg|thumb|The Aconcagua with snow; totally located in the Mendoza Province, it is the highest mon in the world oe the Himalayas, and continues to rise.\nFile:Formosa Argentina.jpg|thumb|250px|Ba\xf1ado La Estrella near Las Lomitas\nFile:Palmar en Resistencia.jpg|thil|300px|Caranday palm trees (Copernicia alba) in the access to Resistencia, Chaco from Corrientes\nMar del Plata is a to city with huge beaches on the Atlantic and the other beaches on the Seaside resorts of the Argentine Sea such as Necochea, Caril\xf3, Villa Gesell, Monte Hermoso, Pehuen-C\xf3, Las Gr (in R\xedo Negro), Rada Tilly in Ch; the Aconcagua (6,959 m), the highest peak in America. For it part -it has been said- Ush is a privileged access to the Argentine Antarctica, the pictue Route of the Adobe and the Tat\xf3n D in the Province of Catamarca; r adventure to in the provinces of Santiago del Estero and La Pampa or in the Y and Calchaqu\xed Valleys, the high Andean desert and js of Chaco, the northern Entre R\xedos (Montiel Forest) and Misiones.\n\nThe B Aires Province is the most pop and largest province of Argentina (if territorial claims in the Antarctica and South Atlantic islands are not taken into account). The nations rail and road network fans out from B Aires and into the province, the area centered on the Pampas. This region is characterized by its estancias (large cattle ranches) the oldest of them being feat in architect styles, located in the middle of the Pampas. The province is also known by its many and different beaches in the coast of the Atlantic Ocean (the most visited being Mar del Plata). The hilly region of Tandil and Sierra de La Ventana (town) offers golf co, paragliding rides and trekking. They are very different landscapes from each other and distant from the mouth of the Paran\xe1 River, which islands are also visited by tos.\n\nMany r of the ancient Jesuit missions - some of which have been covered by the j - are located near Posadas, Misiones. The most well-known r are in San Ignacio Min\xed, 56&nbsp;km away from the province\u2019s capital. The ones in Candelaria, Na Se\xf1ora de Loreto, Na Se\xf1ora de Santa Ana and Red\xf3n de Santa Mar\xeda la Mayor, Argentina|Santa Mar\xeda are also very interesting. These Jesuit redns were declared World Heritage Site by the UNESCO.\n\nFifty kilometers to the north of Col\xf3n, Entre R\xedos|Col\xf3n lies El Palmar National Park, ho the last samples of Yatay palm trees, which are almost eight cent old. The city of Concordia, Entre R\xedos is connected to the city of Salto (Ur) through the Salto Grande Dam.\n\nThe Esteros del Iber\xe1, a h zone of 700.000 hectares can be reached from Posadas, Concepci\xf3n or Mercedes. In G\xed lang|G\xed, Iber\xe1 means "Shining water". Its lagoons cover 31,500 hectares, its marshlands 52,000, and its inlands 260,000. This eco-system which gives life to ts, yacar\xe9s (caimans), monkeys, swamp deer, capybaras - the largest rodent in the world - and up to 400 bird species, besides an extraordinary flora, extends over one million hectares.\n\nThe city of Rosario lies on the banks of the Paran\xe1 River in the Santa Fe Province. It has developed into an indal and commercial center and destination for a significant n of people on bss. On its riverside promenade stands the National Flag Memorial (National Mon to the Flag), where the Flag of Argentina was raised for the first time. Parque Independencia has statues, a raceco, and the Provincial History M.\n\nP Tombo is a coastal location where abt wildlife congregates-specifically the seasonal breeding ground of large ns of Magellanic penguins.<ref>C. Michael Hogan (2008) http://www.megalithic.co.uk/article.php?sid=18657 Pali Aike, The Megalithic Portal, ed. A. Bm \n\nPeninsula Vald\xe9s is widely considered to be one of the best places in the world for the observation of wildlife, mainly sea mammals. Although son right whales are the main attraction elephant seals, sea lions, Magellanic peng and orcas are also well represented.\n\nLaguna del Carbon (the lowest geographical point in the Americas), Mount Fitz Roy, and the Petrified Forests National Mon, as well as the vast patagonian plateau.\n\n\n\nOverall Argentina has the following to circ (north to south):\n* The Argentine Northwest, with contrasting landscapes like walking the Tren a las N (train to the clouds) the arid and the cold of high embellished by cs landforms, saline, alkaline lakes where abound flamingos, geysers and high volcanoes, the transition zone of Calchaqu\xed Valleys and Qda de Las Flechas with mild climates as for cation of vine in Cafayate and good vegetation and, fr east the dense rainforest called the Y. The spectac cs as C del Obispo (in Salta) or the C del Portez, C de Piedras Blancas and C de Capillitas in Catamarca or the C de Miranda in the Argentine province of Rioja.<ref>http://ar.noticias.yahoo.com/destinos-escondidos-caminos-catamarca-paisajes-imponentes-004200869.html\n* The Argentine Northeast that is characterized by its warm spical climate, its dense forests, parks, wetlands (marshes), large rivers with abt fishing and big waterfalls.\n* The sphere of the Sierras de C\xf3rdoba and San Luis, with Mediterranean climate climate-type and abt nat attractions.\n* The circuit of Cuyo (Argentina) with the highest mons of America, r landscapes (canyons like the Atuel Canyon, or the Canyon of J\xe1chal River|J\xe1chal, several spectac landforms: bridges like the P del Inca and castles like Reserva Provincial Castillos de Pincheira of nat rocks), ice formations like Los Penitentes (Argentina), caves and caverns, large volcanic extensions as in the Reserva Provincial La Pay|Pay\xfan, ski resorts or pleasant valleys where stand crops temperate fr, olive trees and vines.\n* The Pampas: a vast plain of temperate climate crossed by million cattle, dotted with nus lakes and possessing a long coastline with long sandy beaches and d where thriving cities and seaside villages.\n* The Argentine Patagonia and more precisely Andean Patagonia, with beal landscapes who meet mons always snowy, ice fields, glaciers, cold forests, large and deep lakes of glacial origin and very rg rivers, winter sports centers and beal "alpine" aspect towns.\n* The Argentine Patagonia: large region of plateaus, mons, canyons, moors and steppes whose coastline has high cliffs, g, penins where seabirds abound (especially penguins) pinnipeds, and whales.\n\n\nCarnival in Argentina are very important and ly take place d the last days of Febr (before the lent), at a time that remains still q s (s in the Son Hemisphere). Almost every carnivals in Argentina come from Ean carnivals in Spain and Italy, so it is spoken in them of ms and corsos, with its masquerades and Gigantes y cabez although there have also infls of African elements from colonial times (the rate of drum in the m is almost obvio of African origin), and in the Qda de Haca (in the northern province of J) and in the small town of Chamical (in Argentine La Rioja) are held a "carnavalito"  and a "chaya" more infld by Andean American Indians. D the second half of the 20th century the cities of the province of Corrientes (mainly Paso de los Libres) and the Province of Entre R\xedos have had a strong infl from the Rio carnival in Brazil the same way as the Carnival de R\xedo in San Luis generally celebrated on the banks of Potrero de los F Dam Lake in Province of San Luis<ref>http://www.carnavalderio.sanluis.gov.ar/\n\n\n\n\nThese are the UNESCOs World Heritage Sites in Argentina:<ref>http://whc.o.org/en/statesparties/ar UNESCO World Heritage Sites: Argentina\n\n*C de las Manos (C de las Manos), Pint River|R\xedo Pint. Has prehistoric cave paintings (WHS since 1999).\n*Iguaz\xfa National Park, home of Ig Falls (1984).\n*Ischigto / Talampaya National Parks and its paleontology formations (2000).\n*Jesuit Block and Estancias of C\xf3rdoba in C\xf3rdoba Province, Argentina|C\xf3rdoba Province (Cal Heritage) (2000).\n*Society of Jesus Mission (Christian) of the Gis: San Ignacio Mini, Santa Ana, Na Se\xf1ora de Loreto and Santa Maria Mayor (1984).\n*Los Glaciares National Park and the Perito Moreno Glacier (1981).\n*Valdes Peninsula|Pen\xednsula Vald\xe9s, a marine wildlife preserve (1999).\n*Qda de Haca, World Cal Landscape (2013).\n\n\n90% of tos come to Ministro Pistarini International Airport in Ezeiza, B Aires, 35&nbsp;km from B Aires, but to continue the jo to some of the destinations of the interior must move to Aeroparque Jorge Newbery (center of B Aires), it is desirable that the trip or transfer (travel) between the two airports is incl in the ticket.\n\n* Exchange: To date (October 2014) there official change and one parallel (called "blue") that is higher. At the airport there is a branch of Banco de la Naci\xf3n Argentina although a convenient way to get Argentine peso is an ated teller machine. As much of the world now  ccies that can be changed are the USD (US dollar) and euro, then followed the Brazilian Real, the pound sterling and yen (in 2014 almost any other foreign ccy is accepted for the  change in Argentina). The best option in 2014 is to change dollar bills for pesos at exchange ho (it should be noted that from late 2012 to late A there is a large disparity between the official rate of the dollar in Argentina (which ranges between 8.50 Argentine pesos by US dollar and in the black market the price is called "dollar blue" (eism for dollar of black market) that comes to be around 15 pesos per US dollar, but it is inadvisable the clandestine change as many tos that change with arbolitos (ccy changers out of the legal system) are often cheated with cofeit ccy or directly be assa.\n* It is not sle to do exhibit large amo of cash or jewelry.\n* Grats: in Argentina no is mandatory tip, however, is a habitual gesture, considering that the attention was correct then tip around 10% of what is cons (in bars, restas, pizzerias, restobars and related and other services -server of hotels). In taxis and remises tip are a few extra pesos with the cost of the ticket. In bars, restas, cinemas, hotels and theaters around 5% to 10% of the cost of conson or service.\n* Argentine ce: The national inf is the Mate (beverage), followed by coffee. The fastest and most pop street food is the chorip\xe1n, which is a sandwich which  chorizo in a cooked criollo style in situ on a grill   "French bread" (In Argentina, french bread refers to white bread with wheat flour), the cooked chorizo of the chorip\xe1n is flavored with the typical chimich. Another fast food available in almost all bars and restas is the "lomito" which is a hot beef sandwich attached with lettuce leaves, slices of tomato, etc.; but more common is the sandwich of milanesa, similar to the above but with the flesh overflowing in breadcr and egg and then fried. The "Chco" or the "costeleta" or the most sent "bife de chorizo" are based on roast beef or hot griddle, which is ly accompanied by french fries, mashed potatoes or salads. The "Asado" or "barbecue" incl several cuts of meat on the grill, but offals or visceral as kidney and gut are not necessarily please the cons is not acced. Also consume roasted goat meat, chicken and pork. Pastas as noodle, dngs and ravioli are very accessible dishes and derivatives large influx of Italian people immigration. In the main cities of Argentina abound pizzerias which can be cons, along with other dishes, pizzas in some cases very different from the typical Italian pizzas (some Italian travelers object that generally the Argentine Neapolitan pizza is not made with real mozzarella of Italian water bo but with Argentine mla based on sheeps milk or even based on cow milk), plus pizzerias are very common the ice cream also tend to inherit the styles of the Italian gelateries. Other very common "boliches" in the Argentine cities are the caf\xe9s and cafetines (Spanish heritage but also with strong Italian infls) and breweries. In some places, mainly in towns of Argentine Northwest and of Cuyo (Argentina) can be found p\xedas and "pe\xf1as" in where predominates the Creole peoples folk food: asados, empanadas, tamales, locro, such establishments, especially if they are "Pe\xf1a (Argentina)|pe\xf1as", often have presentations of Argentine folk m and even tango. Higher level restas and Coffeehouse have a very complete menu with dishes more sophisticated. The Argentine wine are generally very good and economic.\n\nThe typical breakfast served to passengers in hotels is very simple, latte or tea, a co of croissants and little else; is mon in  Argentina the "American breakfast" or "Fr\xfchstuck"; in r areas breakfast ly is mate cocido or - few times admitted by the to - mate drunk in round with shared bulb.\n\nDinner times are from 21:00 onwards. \n\n<gallery mode="packed" heights="135" style="font-size:88%;line-height:120%" styles="font-size:88%;line-height:120%">\nFile:Foz de Igua\xe7u 27 Panorama Nov 2005.jpg|Iguaz\xfa Falls, one of the Seven Nat Wonders of the World.\nFile:Bariloche view.jpg|S view (in winter is snow and a in shimmering red and ocher leaves of trees) of Nahuel H Lake, in the provinces of Neuqu\xe9n Province|Neuqu\xe9n and R\xedo Negro Province|R\xedo Negro.\nFile:Basecat.JPG|The Cerro Catedral in Bariloche d winter, R\xedo Negro Province|R\xedo Negro, is the largest ski resort of Latin America. This is an annual ranking prod by Ethical Traveler magazine, which is based on a study of developing nations from around the world to identify the best to destinations among them. The benchmarking  categories such as environmental protection, social welfare, and h rights.\n\n\nFile:Train to the clouds in Salta -ARGENTINA- 003.JPG|thumb|Sec with the Tren a las n\nThe U.S. Department of State warns travelers in Argentina that "drivers freqy ignore traffic laws and vehicles often travel at excessive speeds... traffic accidents are the primary threat to life and limb in Argentina."<ref>http://travel.state.gov/travel/cis_pa_tw/cis/cis_1130.html#safety U.S Department of State Co G Argentina has the highest traffic mortality rate in South America, with Argentine drivers ca 20 deaths each day (about 7,000 a year), with more than 120,000 people inj or maimed each year. These deaths have incl tos from various parts of the world.<ref>See http://www.los.org.ar/ingles/index.htm Los por la Vida - Asociaci\xf3n Civil \n\n\n*Visa policy of Argentina\n*Ce of Argentina\n*Ce Row(id=496501, title=u'Emperor Entertainment Group', text_clean=u'\n\n\n\n\n\nEmperor Entertainment Group (EEG; ) is one of the largest entertainment groups in Hong Kong fo by Albert Yeung Sau-Shing in and established in Wan Chai in 1986, along with M Icon Entertainment Limited and Emperor Motion Pict, EEG operates  the major conglomerate Emperor Media Group (EMG).\n\nThe major bsses of Emperor Entertainment Group (EEG) include the prodn and distrib of local and foreign records, m phing, artiste management, concert organization, play prodn, movie and TV prodn, new media prodn as well as merchandise licensing and distrib. EEG now has emerged as one of the market leaders of the entertainment ind in Hong Kong.\n\nDedicated to ning young talents, EEG is the cradle of many of the hottest artistes in the Hong Kong m ind. Artistes  EEG management are freq award winners of the territories various annual m award ceremonies. It is especially proud to be three-year consec winner of the S Charged Award, which remains an akable record up till now.\n\n\nEEG was fo by a well-known wealthy bssman in Hong Kong, Albert Yeung. The m label was originally called :zh:\u98db\u5716\u5531\u7247,  1999. D the Fitto era, artist signed  the label incl J Cheung, Bondy Chiu, and the late Roman Tam. The label is affected by 1997 Asian financial crisis, which has ca the label, to be acq by EEG in 1999. D the EEGs acqion of Fitto, Nicholas Tse has become one of the artist rosters.\n\nMost EEGs artists are most pop among Hong Kong entertainment nowadays; some examples include Twins (ml group), Charlene Choi, Gillian Chung, Raymond Lam, Nicholas Tse, Leo Ku and Joey Yung. In the beginning, EEG was only involved in CD and DVD phing; however, they have since diversified their bss to include movie prodn and concert organization.\n\nA division of Emperor Motion Pict, JCE Movies Limited is a film prodn and distrib company co-fo by Hong Kong star, Jackie Chan and Albert Yeung.\n\n\nEEG is involved in a variety of bsses, which include concert organization, CD and DVD phing, advertisements, movies, etc.\nIt also owns EEG Showroom, which sells artist-related merchandise incl signature notebooks and accessories. It also displays a range of special prod not for sale.\n\n;EEG artists:\n*Nicholas Tse (\u8b1d\u9706\u92d2)\n*Jaycee Chan (\u623f\u7956\u540d)\n*Joey Yung (\u5bb9\u7956\u5152)\n*Twins (ml group)\n**Charlene Choi (\u8521\u5353\u598d)\n**Gillian Chung (\u937e\u6b23\u6850)\n*Raymond Lam (\u6797\u5cef)\n*Ken Hung (\u6d2a\u5353\u7acb)\n*Steven Cheung (actor) (\u5f35\u81f4\u6046)\n*Kenny Kwan (\u95dc\u667a\u658c)\n*William Chan (\u9673\u5049\u9706)\n*Edison Chen (\u9673\u51a0\u5e0c) (former)\n\n;M Plus artists:\n*Leo Ku (\u53e4\u5de8\u57fa)\n*Y Cheng (\u912d\u5e0c\u6021)\n*Vincy Chan (\u6cf3\u5152)\n*Sherman Chung (\u937e\u8212\u6f2b)\n*Deep Ng (\u5433\u6d69\u5eb7)\n*Wong Cho-lam (\u738b\u7956\u85cd)\n*Edison Chen (\u9673\u51a0\u5e0c) (former)\n\n;M Icon artists:\n*Anthony Wong (singer) (\u9ec3\u8000\u660e)\n*Don Li (\u674e\u9038\u6717)\n*Mandy Chiang (\u8523\u96c5\u6587)\n*Keith Wong (\u738b\u51f1\u99ff)\n*Gene Gao (\u9ad8\u9060)\n*Alex Wu (\u6248\u4f73\u69ae)\n\n;Others:\n*Michelle Wai (\u8a69\u96c5)\n*Carlos Chan (\u9673\u5bb6\u6a02)\n*Benny Lau (\u5289\u5049\u6046)\n*Eva H (\u9ec3\u8056\u4f9d)\n*Kathy Yuen (\u6e6f\u6021)\n*Dylan Kuo (\u90ed\u54c1\u8d85)\n*Baby Q\n*Gladys Fung (\u99ae\u7693\u8a69)\n*Peter Bei-tak MAN (\u6587\u5f7c\u5f97)\n*Ocean Hai (\u6d77\u9e23\u5a01)\n\n;Pations\n*East Week\n\n\n* In 2003, Albert Yeung was again  investigation by the Independent Commission Against Corrn (Hong Kong), along with Hong Kong singer Juno Mak, for allegedly bribing TVB for the 2003 Jade Solid Gold Top 10 Awards.<ref>kklee105.com.
